Class PasswordCheckerUtility

java.lang.Object
PasswordCheckerUtility
public class PasswordCheckerUtility extends Object
The Password Checker Utility utilizes various methods to check the validity of either a single password or an Array List of several passwords. Upon receiving an invalid password, the Utility throws a corresponding Exception.
Since:
2021/09/11
Author:
Evan Song

  • Method Details

    • isValidLength

      public static boolean isValidLength​(String pass) throws LengthException
      This method checks whether the password being inputed is at least 6 characters long
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      Returns:
      boolean This should always return true, but will not reach the return statement if the password is less than 6 characters long, throwing an exception instead
      Throws:
      LengthException - A custom exception used when a password's length is invalid

    • hasUpperAlpha

      public static boolean hasUpperAlpha​(String pass) throws NoUpperAlphaException
      This method checks whether the password contains an upper case alphabetic character
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      Returns:
      boolean This should always return true, but will not reach the return statement if the password has no upper case alphabetic character, throwing an exception instead
      Throws:
      NoUpperAlphaException - A custom exception used when a password does not contain an upper case character

    • hasLowerAlpha

      public static boolean hasLowerAlpha​(String pass) throws NoLowerAlphaException
      This method checks whether the password contains a lower case alphabetic character
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      Returns:
      boolean This should always return true, but will not reach the return statement if the password has no lower case alphabetic character, throwing an exception instead
      Throws:
      NoLowerAlphaException - A custom exception used when a password does not contain a lower case character

    • hasDigit

      public static boolean hasDigit​(String pass) throws NoDigitException
      This method checks whether the password contains a digit, or a numeric character from 0-9
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      Returns:
      boolean This should always return true, but will not reach the return statement if the password does not contain a number, throwing an exception instead
      Throws:
      NoDigitException - A custom exception used when a password does not contain a numeric character

    • hasSpecialChar

      public static boolean hasSpecialChar​(String pass) throws NoSpecialCharacterException
      This method checks whether the password contains a special character, defined by this program as any character that is not alphanumeric (a letter or number)
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      Returns:
      boolean This should always return true, but will not reach the return statement if the password only contains alphanumeric characters, throwing an exception instead
      Throws:
      NoSpecialCharacterException - A custom exception used when a password does not contain a special character

    • hasSameCharInSequence

      public static boolean hasSameCharInSequence​(String pass) throws InvalidSequenceException
      This method checks whether the password contains the same character three times in a row in any part of the password, ie; liZZZo or &&&&pi
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      Returns:
      boolean This should always return true, but will not reach the return statement if the password has three consecutive identical characters, throwing an exception instead
      Throws:
      InvalidSequenceException - A custom exception used when a password has three of the same character in a row

    • comparePasswordsWithReturn

      public static boolean comparePasswordsWithReturn​(String pass, String pass2)
      This method checks whether two passwords are equal to each other, returning false if they do not match
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      pass2 - This is a String representing a second password, to be compared to the first
      Returns:
      boolean This should return true if the two passwords match, and false if they are different

    • comparePasswords

      public static void comparePasswords​(String pass, String pass2) throws UnmatchedException
      This method checks whether two passwords are equal to each other, throwing an exception if they do not match
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      pass2 - This is a String representing a second password, to be compared to the first
      Throws:
      UnmatchedException - A custom exception used when two passwords do not match each other

    • isValidPassword

      public static boolean isValidPassword​(String pass) throws LengthException, NoUpperAlphaException, NoLowerAlphaException, NoDigitException, NoSpecialCharacterException, InvalidSequenceException
      This method checks whether a password satisfies all components of a valid password, throwing a different exception if any component is missed.
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      Returns:
      boolean This should return true if the password is valid, and should not return anything if the password is invalid, throwing a custom exception instead
      Throws:
      LengthException - A custom exception used when the password is less than 6 characters long
      NoUpperAlphaException - A custom exception used when the password has no upper case characters
      NoLowerAlphaException - A custom exception used when the password has no lower case characters
      NoDigitException - A custom exception used when the password contains no numbers
      NoSpecialCharacterException - A custom exception used when the password has only letters and numbers
      InvalidSequenceException - A custom exception used when the password has three or more consecutive identical characters

    • isWeakPassword

      public static boolean isWeakPassword​(String pass) throws WeakPasswordException
      This method throws an exception if the password has between six and nine characters, making it weak

      Precondition: pass must be a valid password

      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a valid password
      Returns:
      boolean This should throw an exception if the password is weak, returning false otherwise
      Throws:
      WeakPasswordException - A custom exception used when the password is between 6 and 9 characters long

    • hasBetweenSixAndNineChars

      public static boolean hasBetweenSixAndNineChars​(String pass)
      This method checks whether a password has between six and nine characters
      Parameters:
      pass - This is a String representing a password
      Returns:
      boolean This should return true if the password is between 6 and 9 characters, and false otherwise

    • getInvalidPasswords

      public static ArrayList<String> getInvalidPasswords​(ArrayList<String> pws)
      This method takes an Array List of passwords, going through each of them and determining whether each one is valid. Upon finding an invalid password, the offending password is added to an empty Array List along with the reason for invalidity and then, once all of the passwords have been sorted, the Array List of invalid passwords is returned.
      Parameters:
      pws - This is an ArrayList of Strings, each String representing a different password
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of all of the invalid passwords that were present in the input ArrayList, paired with the justification for putting them there
